utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: What if we got married on the Cyclone?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: The rollercoaster at Coney Island?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon! How much fun would that be? And talk about an appropriate, if not slightly on the nose, metaphor. A bride and groom together, side by side, as they go through the ups and downs, the twists and turns, and the loopty-loops of life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I love you. But I will not marry you on a ride or up in space or on a slide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet Dr. Seuss got married somewhere fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. His wife’s living room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How many people do you think can fit in one of those rollercoaster cars, anyway? Twenty, thirty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a good point. We should determine exactly whom we are going to invite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Good idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That way we can determine exactly how big a rollercoaster car we need to build.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or how big of an actual venue we need. Either way, I’ll go and get the paper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll get a pen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I will get the phone. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, there’s a good argument for keeping the list really small. Just immediate family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This argument doesn’t have something to do with a certain amusement park ride, does it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m being serious. Getting married is an intimate act and our ceremony should reflect that intimacy. And that way we can all fit in one car. Ryan, how do you feel about rollercoasters?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, make me nauseous. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s our victim?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Peter Cordero, 26. According to the super he lives alone. He’s a futures trader at J.P Harding, the Wall Street investment firm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how was he killed?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, single GSW to the chest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It looks like his own future got traded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, not without a fight first. Who found the body?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that’s an interesting question. At 10:03PM a woman made a 911 call from a payphone down the block. But she refused to leave her name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A payphone down the block? But how would she know she was dead, unless –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless she was in the apartment.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Well, lividity places the time of death between 8 and 10, so if the 911 call came in at 10: 03 …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She could be our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito’s checking security cam footage. Hopefully we caught her on tape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, is it just me or is it odd that our victim is wearing a suit jacket, tie, pants, shoes … but his shirt is unbuttoned?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s odd, all right. And look at this. His shirt was on and buttoned when he was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our killer unbuttoned his shirt after he was dead.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer was looking for something. A pricey necklace. Ooh, a bunch of cash strapped to his chest like Wolf of Wall Street.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There’s something else. I didn’t find any defensive wounds. So if there was a fight out there, I don’t think this guy was in it.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett. There are no security cameras in the lobby, but I found on in the liquor store down the street. It got a shot of that payphone right when that 911 call came in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, canvass the neighbors. See if anyone saw her in the building. Did you talk to next of kin yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the guy didn’t have any immediate family, but he did list a cousin in Queens, a Maria Cordero, as his in case of emergency.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, bring her in. Let’s see if she recognizes the woman in the photo. Castle and I will go to his place of work and see what they know there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MARIA CORDERO
utterance.content: No. No. I’m sorry. I don’t know her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maria, did your cousin say anything about having a girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No. He said he didn’t have time. Work was his life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Were the two of you close?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Peter was like my brother. When he was 10 his parents died in the big earthquake in Venezuela. My parents adopted him and brought him to the States.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did Peter say anything about having any enemies?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No. Peter was a sweet guy. He never forgot where he came from, not like those privileged, silver-spoon guys he worked with. He was a scholarship kid, so everything that he got was through hard work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When did you talk to him last?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: A few days ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did he seem?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Stressed, actually.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did he say what about?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No … I – I don’t know. When I asked him he said something happened at work, but it wasn’t anything he couldn’t handle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: J.P Harding Investment Bank. This place is either the engine of capitalism or the poster child of greed and corruption, depending on which paper you read.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the invisible hand of the market killed Peter. It would explain the lack of defensive wounds. You know, prep school buddy of mine came to work here after college. He made a quarter of a billion dollars before he was 30, retired, and bought an island.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, he owns his own island? We should definitely invite him to the wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me? Hi, I’m Detective Beckett. We need to speak with Peter Cordero’s boss. Jamie Burman, I believe?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Can I tell him what it’s regarding?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE BURMAN
utterance.content: Killing. Are you capable of it? Because if you are, I will make you rich. Goldman just poached Consolidated’s pension account from us this morning. So I am offering a bounty. Neal.

utterance.speaker: NEAL
utterance.content: A million dollars. To the first son of a b*tch at this table to poach an account back from Goldman.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: It’s open season, guys. Open hunting season. I want you to make them bleed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Excuse me, Mr. Burman. Detective Beckett. Could we have a word, please?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: I told you SEC pricks to talk to my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not SEC. I’m NYPD. Homicide.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Homicide?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: I apologize for the theatrics, Detective, but in this world it gets results.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And here I thought the stories of Wall Street excess were exaggerated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Burman, I understand that Peter Cordero reported directly to you.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Yes. He was my best commodities trader. And one of the nicest guys you’ll ever meet, in this part of the world, at least. Do you have any leads?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, just one. Do you recognize this woman?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: No. I’m afraid I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well according to Peter Cordero’s family, he was having some trouble here at work. Do you have any idea what that might have been?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: No idea. In fact, he was having one of the best months he’d ever had.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about his clients? Any problems there?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: No. Pete was a rising star. His clients loved him. But …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But what?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Last week I was taking the stairs to the 65th floor – my version of exercise – and I saw Peter in the stairwell with this guy who looked like a gangbanger. All tatted up his neck, a big scar on his cheek. Not the kind of guy you’d ever see down here. And he was handing Peter a package about yay big . When Peter saw me, he looked guilty as hell. So I just kept walking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you didn’t ask him about it?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I did later. But he said it was nothing, so I just let it go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You saw a gangbanger in your stairwell and you just let it go?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: This is a high stress environment, Detective. We don’t ask a lot of questions about what our people do to … to get through the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Do you think you can describe him to a sketch artist?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. I need the names of all of Peter’s associates here at work.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s got something for us.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Still no indication of defensive wounds, but I did find this when I checked his nails for DNA.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Numbers. 7 2 3 5 9 8?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He wrote in in pen, I’d say four or five days ago. But that’s not why I called you. Look at this. On his chest, next to the Y incision.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at what?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s subtle, so subtle I almost missed it. But I think it explains why his shirt was ripped open. You see this grainy material?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s adhesive residue. In fact, there’s a residue pattern from his belly to his chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adhesive?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looking at the pattern, I’d say your Wall Street wolf was wearing a wire.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A wire?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir. We believe our killer removed it from the victim’s body after shooting him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do we know who he was wearing a wire for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re checking with other branches of law enforcement right now.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about this woman who called in the murder? Have you been able to identify her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, no one in Cordero’s life seems to know who she is and we have no idea where to find her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – think she just found us.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh lord. I’d say your case just got a lot more complicated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it, sir?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They’re from the US Attorney’s office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know them?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not the woman from the photo, but the woman with her is Elizabeth Weston, the US Attorney for the southern district. She also happens to be my sister.

utterance.speaker: ELIZABETH WESTON
utterance.content: Victoria. It’s been awhile.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes, it has.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Who is this?

utterance.speaker: STEPHANIE GOLDMARK
utterance.content: I’m Stephanie Goldmark, assistant US Attorney. We’re here about the Cordero murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, well that’s funny. Because we have a few questions about that ourselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Starting, Ms. Goldmark, with why you didn’t identify yourself when you made that 911 call from the pay phone.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Because I instructed her not to. I couldn’t afford to compromise our investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What investigation?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Is there somewhere private we can talk?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right, Elizabeth. What’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Your victim was a confidential informant for my office in an ongoing criminal investigation of J.P Harding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why Cordero was wearing a wire.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: Yes, and since J.P Harding is on the 65th floor we couldn’t monitor it live. Cordero put it on every morning and turned it in every night, along with the attached recording device.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only last night he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: I went to his apartment to see what happened. That’s when I found him. And the wire was gone.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: We think that there was something key to our investigation on that wire and that’s why he was killed. So where are you on leads?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, uh … ballistics is running the slug, but right now the only lead is this sketch provided by Mr. Cordero’s boss, Jamie Burman. It’s of a man he saw with our victim.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t put much credence in that sketch.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Why? Why is that?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Because Burman is the target of our investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jamie Burman, head of J.P Harding?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: We’ve been trying to mount a case against him for years. Insider trading, securities fraud. We know he’s doing it, we just haven’t been able to get proof.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: Not without getting inside. Burman’s too careful. Then last month we caught a break. Peter Cordero was found with a baggie of cocaine during a stop and frisk. With his priors for possession when he was a teen he was facing five to ten.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You got Cordero to play ball?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: He jumped at an immunity deal. He had already gotten valuable information on his wire recordings, but yesterday he was scheduled to meet with Burman one on one. He was going to push him to open up about some of his deals.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: Cordero may have pushed too hard. We think that Burman made Cordero in that meeting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you think Jamie Burman is somehow responsible for Cordero’s death?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Well, if Burman knew he had incriminated himself on tape –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He would go to any length to get it back.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Victoria, this investigation is ongoing and exposing it to Mr. Burman or anyone at J.P Harding would break federal statutes. But I thought that this something that you and your team needed to know.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’d certainly say so.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: So I trust that you will keep my office in the loop if there are any … significant developments. Is that clear?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I didn’t – I didn’t know you had a sister.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, well … now you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: US Attorney for the southern district. That’s a really big deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why hasn’t Gates ever mentioned her before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but there was definitely a subtle chill between the two of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A subtle chill? More like a polar vortex. I’m guessing something happened between them in the past. Something deeply personal that Gates does not want us to know about. I’ll give you a dollar if you ask her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on! Aren’t you curious?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but I like my job too much.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, uh … so there might be something to the US Attorney’s theory. I checked Cordero’s calendar. He was scheduled to meet with Burman at 5PM yesterday and whatever they talked about, it got heated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to building security, the two of them left shortly after and seemed to be in the middle of a fight.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Peter and I had words yesterday, so what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you didn’t tell us about that when we talked this morning.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Because it wasn’t relevant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is it not relevant? The video shows you leaving together. Two hours later he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: It’s not relevant because I didn’t kill him. Honestly, Detective, what would be my motive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What exactly were the two of you arguing about?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: A business deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You looked pretty worked up for a business deal.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: There was a lot riding on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the deal?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Client confidentiality, Detective. I’m not at liberty to discuss it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You had a meeting with Peter before that. What were you speaking about then?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Other financial matters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of financial matters?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Sensitive ones! Any discussion of which, even with law enforcement, would be considered insider trading. So unless you have a subpoena –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else was at the meeting?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you do after you left the lobby?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: We walked up Lafayette and parted ways around Spring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Around 6:15.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you between 8 and 10?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: At my usual table at Le Cirque. Feel free to check.

utterance.speaker: NEAL
utterance.content: It’s time.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have a conference call with the Fed. Oh, and if you want to talk to me again, Detective, call my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Le Cirque confirms that Burman was there from 8PM ‘til 10:25. It couldn’t have been him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because a guy like Burman isn’t going to get his hands dirty. He’s going to hire someone. No, your sister’s right. Burman’s behind this. Speaking of your sister –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Let’s not. If Burman is behind this, he will do everything he can to protect himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knowing that the Feds are watching him he would be careful to cover his tracks. It’s going to be next to impossible to trace this back to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So all we’re really sure of is that the sketch he gave us is a load of fictitious crap meant to send us in the wrong direction.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not as fictitious as you think. I just got the ballistics back on the bullet that killed Cordero. Striations match the slug that was pulled from a robbery shooting at a bodega in the Bronx three months ago. The detectives couldn’t make a case, but their three best suspects were gang members, including this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same guy.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Same gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hector Nunez?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, runs the South Bronx territory of Los Caballeros gang. Priors include assault, attempted manslaughter, and conspiracy to distribute cocaine.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No, you’re wrong. Peter had nothing to do with cocaine. He hated drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know he was arrested last month for possession?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: That’s impossible. I know Peter. He’d never use that stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure, Maria? Because he was seen receiving a package last week from this guy.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: No. No. It can’t be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You recognize him?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Hector Nunez. He was Peter’s best friend growing up. But then he got mixed up in a gang and he tried to drag Peter in, too. Afterwards Hector changed. He became dangerous. Peter cut ties with him over a decade ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you think of any reason he’d be back in Peter’s life?

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Hector was a devil. Peter would have never gotten mixed up with him again.

utterance.speaker: MARIA
utterance.content: Unless … he didn’t have a choice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a long way from Wall Street.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This doesn’t make any sense. If Peter was into drugs, he had enough money to get them from downtown. Why would he risk getting them from someone he knew was dangerous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There it is. El Baile Club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, unofficial headquarters of Los Caballeros. Stay close. If Hector’s as dangerous as advertised things might get a little hairy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hairy’s my middle name. It sounded a lot better in my head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure this is the right place? Those guys don’t look very dangerous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about those guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. You mean the heavily armed ones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking for Hector Nunez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hector Nunez? Detective Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: HECTOR NUNEZ
utterance.content: Detective shouldn’t be here. You could get hurt. It’s a dangerous neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, maybe I should take you down to my neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Let me save you some time. Whatever it is, I didn’t do it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I suppose you’ve never heard of a Peter Cordero, either?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: What about Peter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s dead.

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Who did this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well we were thinking you. … … might be able to tell us.

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: I’d never hurt Peter. He was my best friend. When we were friends and the gang wanted to take him, I wouldn’t let them. I knew he could do better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did he end up shot and killed with your gun?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Something was going on with him. He called me last week for the first time in years. Said he was into some deal that was going to make him rich. But it was dangerous. In case someone really needed to protect himself, he said he needed a weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying you gave him that gun?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Well he said he couldn’t buy one himself because he was being watched all the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was that what was in the package you gave him in the stairwell?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The deal that he was into, was it drugs?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Not drugs. Money. Something to do with bank accounts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bank accounts?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: Last Thursday night he came to me, said he needed one last favor. He wanted me to take an envelope to the manager of some bank in Midtown. Suisse Federal or something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why couldn’t he just do it himself? Why did he need you?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: He said he couldn’t be seen at the bank. It was too risky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was in the envelope?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: He said something about transfer instructions. It was sealed, but there was a bank account number written on the outside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember the number?

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: I wrote it down in case something went wrong. I guess it did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not the same six digit number that was on his hand.

utterance.speaker: NUNEZ
utterance.content: After I took the envelope to the bank I called Peter at work to confirm it was done. That’s the last time we talked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hector’s alibi checks out. He was at City of Mercy Nursing Home visiting his mom when Peter was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mysterious financial transactions, a deal so dangerous he needed a gun? Seems to me there’s a lot more to your sister’s star witness than she knew.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Than she knew or than she chose to tell us about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Talked to the manager at Suisse Federal. He confirmed that a bank account with those numbers exists. But he refused to give out any information on it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did he at least acknowledge it was Peter Cordero’s account?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He couldn’t. Because he didn’t know himself. It’s a numbered account, set up for privacy, so the only way that anyone can access it is with a password.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So there’s no way to know what Cordero was doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless … Six digits? Seems kind of password-y to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, read it to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle, you’ve done it again.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What’s it say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The balance is zero dollars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Zero dollars? That doesn’t seem very dangerous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It feels like the end of a treasure hunt where you open up the chest and it’s just full of sand.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wait, go to the day Mr. Nunez claims he did the transfer. March 21st.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God. 25 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa. Looks like some expensive sand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like it came into the account the day before at 8:34 in the morning and then Hector transferred it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A secret 25 million dollar transfer that got him killed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What the hell was Cordero into?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I just talked to the head of Suisse Federal Bank. Given international banking regulations, there’s no way to tell where that money came from or where it went.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or if the money is even Cordero’s. He could have been moving it for someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if this transaction is somehow responsible for Cordero’s death and we can’t track it then we may never be able to find his killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: There may be another way.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: 25 million?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s right. And your informant went to a great deal of trouble to keep it secret.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: And you have no idea where the money came from?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, but odds are it’s what got him killed. Elizabeth, if you know anything about this …

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Of course I don’t know anything about this. You don’t believe me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do you blame me?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: I didn’t know. And given the lengths he went to hide the transaction, he clearly didn’t want me to know.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Then I’m going to need access to Peter Cordero’s wire recordings.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Because there may be something on those tapes that’s relevant to his murder.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: We went through them. If there was anything on there we would have heard it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not if you weren’t listening for it.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Victoria, but those wire records are privileged part of a confidential investigation. I can’t give you access.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Can’t, or won’t? Do you think I’m blind? Bringing down someone as big as Burman, you’d be able to write your own ticket. The mayor’s office, attorney general. Everything you always dreamed of. But you need Cordero’s testimony. And if he was involved in anything dirty while acting as a witness, it would jeopardize your whole case. That’s why you won’t give us those tapes. Because you’re afraid of what we might find.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Taking down a shark like Burman would send a signal to every fraudulent actor in the financial markets. I have to think about the greater good.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, is that what you tell yourself so you can sleep at night?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: You could never play the game, could you? It’s why you’re stuck behind a desk instead of running the entire force down at 1PP.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I am not stuck anywhere. And I will never, never apologize for doing my job to the letter of the law. Now, I’m going to need those wire recordings. Or do I have to go over your head?

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Anything you find, you bring it to me first. Do you understand? I will not have you screw up another one of my investigations?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s not put her on the list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I feel bad for Gates. My sisters can never work together. I tell you, when the two of them went at it, oof.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wouldn’t mind going at it with Gates’s sister.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How would you like having Gates as your sister-in-law?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So on March 21st, Peter Cordero’s wire picked up a phone call from Hector Nunez to confirm that the transfer was done. The call came in at 9:25AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s pretty much what Hector said.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but listen to the next two calls that Peter makes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s saying “I’m calling on behalf of Armando Garcia. Want to make sure that his money was received. Can you confirm the amount?” Then he says “thank you” and hangs up.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Who is Armando Garcia?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We checked with J.P Harding, they don’t have any clients by that name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it wasn’t company business.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Now, listen to the second call.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: Is he in? This is Peter Cordero calling. Hey, everything’s taken care of, but we’re running out of time. We need to get this done in the next couple of days. Is that going to be a problem? Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Everything’s taken care of.” That must be about the 25 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: But what exactly was getting done in the next couple of days? And how did it get him killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to find Armando Garcia.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Unfortunately it’s a pretty common name. There are hundreds of Armando Garcias in the US alone. It’s going to be hard to narrow it down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless we can find out who he was calling. At 9:25 Peter would have been at work. He would have made those phone calls from his desk phone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If we can get those phone records they could tell us what he was involved in.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll put in for a warrant. Hopefully we’ll get it by morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I was thinking about Gates’s sister and it got me wondering: do you have any family I don’t know about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Because this intimate wedding of ours –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no. You too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How bad is yours?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got over a hundred.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m at three hundred … over that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Four hundred?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, to be fair I am world famous. –ish. Look, it’s a first draft. It just needs some editing. Brutal, ruthless editing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Michael Connelly? You haven’t seen him in over a year. And do you not remember what he wrote about your last book? No. I think we’ve got our first edit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I have to invite Connelly because if he finds out that Jonathan Kellerman made the cut, and I have to invite Kellerman because I have to invite Wes Craven and Stephen King.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but we’ve got to start somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I think I know where. Aunt Theresa? Really? After what she posted about me on Facebook?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She took it down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are we going to do? We can’t have five hundred people at the wedding.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Hello, you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, help has arrived in the form of a neutral third party. Someone who was born to be brutal and ruthless.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah hah. Still working on the invite list, I see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, actually. And would you mind joining us?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Love to. Let me get my list. Oh, you know, I had no idea how many people I needed to invite until I wrote them all down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good news, I crossed referenced my mother’s list with my list. We have three names in common.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Three names. That’s … great. That takes us from what, 585 to 582? There’s got to be a better way to cut this down. Ryan, you guys kept your wedding small. What was it, like a hundred people?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s all we could afford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you … contain the list?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have a lot of relatives that hate me now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So the warrant on Cordero’s phone finally came through. Whoever this Armando Garcia is, it has something to do with Venezuela.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s where Peter was from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that first call confirming the 25 million? It was made to a bank in Venezuela.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The second call was to the Venezuela consulate right here in the city. It was a direct line of a senior official there, a Luis Delgado.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clandestine wire transfers, a high ranking consulate official, all circling around the mysterious Armando Garcia. What was Cordero doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I can’t wait to find out. Swiss bank accounts, secret money transfers. It’s got international intrigue written all over it.

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: It was just a simple passport request.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A passport request?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: Yes. That’s why he called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the money?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: I’m afraid I don’t anything about any money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? I suppose you’ve never heard of Armando Garcia, either?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: Armando Garcia? Yes, of course I’ve heard of Armando Garcia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: That’s who I got the passport for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, I thought that the passport was for Peter Cordero.

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: Yes. Peter Cordero, Armando Garcia. It’s the same guy. When his aunt and uncle moved him to New York he changed his name to fit in. But his birth name was Armando Garcia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was sending the money to himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said he was requesting a passport. A Venezuelan passport?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: Yes, of course. Cordero applied to reestablish his Venezuelan citizenship and we were more than happy to oblige.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under the name Armando Garcia.

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: That’s right. But um … there was something odd about his request. He asked to pick up the passport in Mexico City.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mexico City? Did he say why?

utterance.speaker: VENEZUELAN DIPLOMAT
utterance.content: No. But he was supposed to get it yesterday, at our embassy there. He had booked a flight from Mexico City to Caracas that night.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He was running away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not just running away. Changing his identity completely.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He never intended to testify. He was just stringing my sister along until he could escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All he had to do was drive to Mexico. Once he boarded that flight to Caracas under his new identity, paid for with a new credit card, Peter Cordero would cease to exist. Your sister would never find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he wasn’t going to leave empty handed, so he made one last desperate deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The night he was killed, he was preparing to disappear forever along with the 25 million.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You just don’t conjure 25 million dollars out of thin air. It came from somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And given the circumstances, nowhere legal.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: If you’re right, it’ll destroy my sister’s case. All his testimony will be tainted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Find the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In order to do that, we need to know where the money came from. And there’s no way to find out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … maybe there is. You know that secret Armando Garcia credit card? You know, the one he used to buy the plane tickets? We found another charge on it for a computer station he rented at an internet café.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was there the exact same time that 25 million showed up in his account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So whatever he was doing, it was related to the transfer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That café has security video. If we can get a look at the computer screen or Peter’s fingers on the keyboard maybe we can figure out where that money came from.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And why he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, uh … you okay?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ah … just trying to figure out how to tell my sister her case is compromised without her blaming me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she blame you? I mean, you’re just doing your job.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: There’s a history.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: 1998. I had just been made head of Internal Affairs. Elizabeth was in the DA’s office. We called ourselves the dynamic duo. At the time Elizabeth was closing in on a heroin ring in east New York and they had an undercover inside. His testimony was key to the case, but …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was dirty?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He skimmed a few eight balls off the very boss Elizabeth was building her case around. When my office caught him reselling it, she came to me. Begged me not to file charges. Asked me to think of the greater good. I did my job that day, too.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It hasn’t been the same between us since.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The security video is in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s Cordero.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the angle is over the monitor. We can’t see the screen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or the keyboard. There’s no way to tell what he’s doing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Wait. Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take a look at the time code. It’s right around the moment the 25 million got into Cordero’s Swiss bank account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s him. He transferred the money to Cordero.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A covert transfer from an untraceable IP address paid for under an alias. These people look extraordinary measures to keep from being discovered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zoom in. Freeze it. Wait, that’s Cordero’s boss. That’s Jamie Burman.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would Burman secretly pay Cordero 25 million dollars?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only one reason. Cordero must have told Burman about the US Attorney’s investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Burman was paying him to throw the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Burman was paying Cordero to throw the case then the recordings from his wire were all lies. Burman was feeding the US Attorney’s office false evidence.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And if Elizabeth was building her case on that, she would have been torn apart by the defense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keeping her out of Burman’s business for quite a while, if not forever.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All this time, my sister thought she was taking down Burman when he was really trying to take down her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The one thing it doesn’t explain, though, is why Cordero was killed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Burman’s up to his eyeballs in this. You bring him in here and find out what he knows.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: I’m afraid you’re mistaken, Detective. I didn’t transfer any money to Mr. Cordero. Certainly not 25 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet the moment that you pressed that button 25 million dollars showed up in Cordero’s account.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: You have no evidence that account belongs to Mr. Cordero. Just as you have no evidence that money came from my client.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why were you with him in that internet café?

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: They have good coffee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think there’s a reason why you went out of your way to keep that transfer a secret. I think Cordero told you that he was being forced to be an informant for the US Attorney. And knowing that he would never be able to work again he struck a deal with you. 25 million in exchange for providing false evidence to undermine the investigation.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: What investigation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know exactly what investigation. And when you found out that he wasn’t going to finish the job, that he was going to leave town and take your money with him, you had him killed. And then you took the wire you knew he was wearing to cover up any recorded evidence of the murder.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: That’s all wild speculation.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: Not to mention you have your facts wrong. You said Peter was wearing his wire when he was killed? I’m afraid that’s not possible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you knew about the wire. You admit you were in on it with him.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: Jamie –

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: It’s not illegal to know. And I guarantee you, you will never link me to that payment, so you’ll never be able to prove witness tampering. But yeah, I knew about the wire. And Peter wasn’t wearing it when he was killed because he had already left it for the Feds at the dead drop at Lafayette and Spring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you even – The walk that you took together. You were with him.

utterance.speaker: BURMAN
utterance.content: I saw him go into the mailbox store and put it into one of those boxes.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: There’s been a break in the case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, actually. New information has surfaced about Peter Cordero’s murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: In fact, it seems someone in the US Attorney’s office lied about Cordero not leaving his wire at the dead drop the night of his death.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: No one lied. I went to the drop myself. It wasn’t there.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Elizabeth.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Tell her.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Stephanie, if Peter never turned in his wire, how did that day’s recordings end up on your computer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, even though you erased them, the tech department here was able to recover everything.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Standard procedure was to turn them over for analysis the next morning, but you listened to those tapes that night and you heard something you weren’t supposed to. At least not until Cordero was gone.

utterance.speaker: PETER
utterance.content: I came to the US believing in the American dream, so I worked hard and tried to be honest in a corrupt government, plants drugs on me, threatens to destroy my future, all because you need someone to testify? How am I supposed to still believe? I did everything I could to play by the rules, but no one else does. So by the time you hear this, I’ll be gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We brought in the cop that busted Cordero.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He confessed to planting the cocaine. On your orders.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: Why, Stephanie?

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: You said you needed someone on the inside. To make the case against Burman., For the greater good.

utterance.speaker: WESTON
utterance.content: No. Not like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you heard that recording and found out Peter was leaving, you knew it would all come out. So you went to his place.

utterance.speaker: GOLDMARK
utterance.content: I went to try and talk to him. But he wouldn’t listen.
